results.title: Not just a spectator
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: It is a mistake to think that physically disabled people cannot play sport. They can actively compete in many sports and recreational activities, and greatly benefit from the special classes geared to their needs. Shows how the trained instructors, helpers and general public can help and encourage them.

results.title: Not by books alone
results.brief_description: How people make use of the various community services made available by the local public library, including film and radio programs, concerts, art exhibitions and other special activities for children and teenagers. The library shown in the film is the Rochester Public Library, USA.

results.title: Not at random
results.brief_description: World population is now 3.6 billion. The human race has doubled its numbers since 1920. It may have doubled again by the end of the century. This is a report on the population problem in Southeast Asia showing the various dimensions of the problem, including the different attitudes of people in cities and rural areas toward birth control and family planning. A solution to the population crisis must be found before any real attempt can be made to overcome many of the major problems facing the world today so as to ensure the quality of life and social justice of all.

results.title: Not a bedroom war
results.creator_credit: Kay Pavlou, Anna Grieve, Anne Deveson, Anne Deveson Productions and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: A Global Forum of Women was held in Dublin in 1992, a gathering of women leaders from around the world, assessing together the gains already made by feminism and the ground still to be covered to eliminate prejudice against women. The women discussed the need for, and importance of, a diversity of women in positions of leadership to serve as role models, the problems of balancing career and family, and women as an economic and political force. Those interviewed include Mary Robinson, President of Ireland, Dr Anne Summers, women’s adviser to the Australian Prime Minister, Betty Friedan, author of “The Feminine Mystique”, Bella Abzug, former US Congresswoman, Devaki Jain, Indian economist, Dame Jocelyn Barrow, UK broadcaster, Iola Mathews of the ACTU, and Ruth Bamela Engo-Tjega from Cameroon who works for the UN.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kay Pavlou, Anna Grieve, Anne Deveson, Anne Deveson Productions and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service

results.title: Nostromo. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Alastair Reid, Fernando Ghia, BBC, Pixit, Radiotelevisione Italiana, Television Espanola and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Joseph Conrad, set in South America in the late 1880’s. An Englishman, Charles Gould, and his wife Emilia return to his childhood home to reopen his silver mine. Determined to make the mine succeed, he becomes involved in corruption, conspiracy and revolution. Gould becomes obsessed with saving the silver mine but there is only one man he can trust - Nostromo. Starring Colin Firth, Claudio Amendola, Lothaire Bluteau, Albert Finney, Claudia Cardinale and Brian Dennehy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alastair Reid, Fernando Ghia, BBC, Pixit, Radiotelevisione Italiana, Television Espanola and WGBH (Boston)

results.title: Nosferatu. Vampyr
results.brief_description: Dreyer’s ‘Vampyr’ (dir. Carl Theodor Dreyer, prods. Carl Theodor Dreyer, Nicolas de Gunsburg) redefined the Vampire by casting an eerie woman as the vampire and shooting the entire film with black gauge on the lens to create a haunting, misty mis-en-scene that lingers with each viewing. Cast includes Julian West, Maurice Schutz and Sybille Schmitz. ‘Nosferatu’ (dir. F. W. Murnau, prods. Albin Grau, Enrico Dieckmann) is the original Dracula movie, complete with misty woods, wolves, phantom ships, mutes, coaches and grotesque figures, tropes that are considered standard today in the genre. Cast includes Max Schreck, Alexander Granach and Gustav von Wangenheim. Also included on the tape a rehearsals from varying productions of Dracula.

results.title: Nosferatu (Dracula). - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Paul Killiam, Saul J. Turell and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
A horror tale about a vampire who stalks his victims in the deepening shadows of the night. An edited version of the 1922 German silent motion picture, Nosferatu (Dracula), directed by F. W. Murnau, with commentary. Cast features Max Schreck as Dracula.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Killiam, Saul J. Turell and Sterling Educational Films

results.title: Norwegian children: farming on a fiord
results.brief_description: A farm family on a fiord in Western Norway. Shows activities of children and mother tending livestock on the mountains during summer; dairying activities such as milking, cheese making and transporting milk to the dairy in the valley. Concludes with a neighbourhood festival to celebrate the homecoming of the women and the children.
